definitions.text: a person who possesses great material wealth
have or possess, either in a concrete or an abstract sense
examples: She has $1,000 in the bank
He has got two beautiful daughters
She holds a Master's degree from Harvard
This restaurant features the most famous chefs in France

definitions.text: go through (mental or physical states or experiences)
examples: get an idea
experience vertigo
get nauseous
receive injuries
have a feeling
He owns three houses in Florida
How many cars does she have?

definitions.text: cause to move; cause to be in a certain position or condition
examples: He got his squad on the ball
This let me in for a big surprise
He got a girl into trouble

definitions.text: serve oneself to, or consume regularly
examples: Have another bowl of chicken soup!
I don't take sugar in my coffee

definitions.text: have a personal or business relationship with someone
examples: have a postdoc
have an assistant
have a lover
hold a reception
have, throw, or make a party
give a course
I have two years left
I don't have any money left
They have two more years before they retire
What do we have here?
Now we have a fine mess
The stocks had a fast run-up
She has arthritis

definitions.text: cause to do; cause to act in a specified manner
examples: The ads induced me to buy a VCR
My children finally got me to buy a computer
My wife made me buy a new sofa

definitions.text: receive willingly something given or offered
examples: The only girl who would have him was the miller's daughter
I won't have this dog in my house!
Please accept my present

definitions.text: get something; come into possession of
examples: receive payment
receive a gift
receive letters from the front
She suffered a fracture in the accident
He had an insulin shock after eating three candy bars
She got a bruise on her leg
He got his arm broken in the scuffle
Nicklaus had a 70
The Brazilian team got 4 goals
She made 29 points that day
My wife had twins yesterday!
He had taken this woman when she was most vulnerable
